text:
implementing a naive forecast strategy. For a given dataset of historical observations, we can
persist any value in that history, that is from the previous observation at index -1 to the ﬁrst
observation in the history at -(len(data)). The naive forecast() function below implements
the naive forecast strategy for a given oﬀset from 1 to the length of the dataset.
# one-step naive forecast
def naive_forecast(history, n):
return history[-n]
